docs.snippet: The United States said Friday it has secured the support of the U.N. Security Council for a new package of sanctions designations that target smuggling at sea by North Korea.

headline.print_headline: US Says Security Council Approves New Sanctions on NKorea
headline.main: US Says Security Council Approves New Sanctions on NKorea

headline.main: Breaking Down the 27 Words of the Second Amendment

The special election in Pennsylvania has not been decided, but with a new congressional map coming in November, candidates are planning their next moves.

docs.snippet: Nearly a week after President Donald Trump signed a memorandum banning some transgender people from serving in the U.S. military, Pentagon officials on Thursday refused to answer questions about the policy except to say they would continue to foll...

headline.print_headline: Pentagon Silent on U.S. Transgender Policy

docs.snippet: Your daily look at late-breaking news, upcoming events and the stories that will be talked about today:
Swiss engineering company ABB is considering acquisitions to increase its capabilities in artificial intelligence, Chief Executive Ulrich Spiesshofer said on Thursday.

headline.print_headline: ABB on the Hunt for Acquisitions in Artificial Intelligence
headline.main: ABB on the Hunt for Acquisitions in Artificial Intelligence

docs.snippet: China's Defence Ministry said on Thursday it was coordinating with the United States on a possible visit to China by U.S. Defense Secretary Jim Mattis, which would be the first such trip under U.S. President Donald Trump's administration.

headline.print_headline: China Says It Is 'Coordinating' With U.S. Over Possible Mattis Visit
headline.main: China Says It Is 'Coordinating' With U.S. Over Possible Mattis Visit

docs.snippet: Japan's industrial production rebounded in February from a large decline in the previous month and companies forecast further gains in coming months in a sign that factory output is back on the path toward expansion.

headline.print_headline: Japan February Output Points to Further Expansion, Trade Friction a Risk
headline.main: Japan February Output Points to Further Expansion, Trade Friction a Risk
